title: How to use the Kindle app to read a book you purchased on Amazon - Quora

response.answer_text: If you’re talking about a a Kindle ebook, it will be in your list of books under your account heading. Your Content and Devices. If your app didn’t pick it up automatically, you can use the drop-down to send it to the Cloud or wherever is available. All physical reader devices should be registered with Amazon. I have Kindles, cell phones with the app, computers with the app, and pads with the app all registered as my devices at Amazon. The ebooks show up almost automatically if you have a registered Kindle device. I have to keep removing my husband’s military SF books from my Fire. He gets a lot of freebies to check them out. I don’t know how many he actually reads.

Make sure that you have a WiFi signal/data connection on your phone or tab.Download the Kindle app.Sign in to the Kindle app - use the user ID and password that you used for buying the ebook on Amazon.In the Kindle app search for the title of the ebook that you just purchased.The search results will be divided into “Your library” and “Kindle store”. Your purchases will appear in “Your library”.Tap the title/cover of the ebook. The book will download to your phone (if it isn’t already downloaded).Start reading.
